summary: This document is a criminal history record response from the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services to the FBI, providing detailed criminal history information for two individuals named Michael Thomas, requested on November 18, 2019. It includes arrest records, dispositions, and identification data from multiple states.

persons.name: Thomas, Michael A.
persons.context: Individual with a criminal history in New Jersey, arrested in 2010 for domestic violence-related offenses including aggravated assault, criminal restraint, criminal mischief, harassment, and unlawful firearm possession, which were later dismissed via pre-trial intervention.

persons.name: Wilkie-Thomas, Michael Jr.
persons.context: Individual with a criminal history maintained by multiple states (South Carolina, Georgia, Washington, Indiana, North Carolina), identified in an NCIC Interstate Identification Index search.

events.title: Arrest of Michael A. Thomas
events.description: Michael A. Thomas was arrested by the Plainfield Police Department in New Jersey for multiple offenses including aggravated assault, criminal restraint, criminal mischief, harassment, and unlawful firearm possession.

events.title: Case disposition for Michael A. Thomas
events.description: All charges against Michael A. Thomas were dismissed via pre-trial intervention (PTI) in Plainfield Municipal Court.

events.title: Sentencing for Michael A. Thomas
events.description: Michael A. Thomas received a 12-month diversion program sentence in Union County Superior Court for criminal mischief and harassment charges.

events.title: FBI criminal history inquiry
events.description: The FBI requested criminal history information through the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services, resulting in this record response.

locations: Alfred E. Smith Building, 80 South Swan St., Albany, New York 12210
keyFacts: The FBI requested criminal history information on November 18, 2019, for individuals named Michael Thomas through the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services.

Michael A. Thomas (SID NJ240238E) was arrested on June 11, 2010, in Plainfield, NJ, for domestic violence-related charges including aggravated assault, criminal restraint, and unlawful firearm possession.
All charges against Michael A. Thomas were dismissed on September 19, 2011, via pre-trial intervention (PTI) after he completed a 12-month diversion program.
A separate individual, Michael Wilkie-Thomas Jr. (FBI No. 411984XA8), has a criminal history maintained by five states: South Carolina, Georgia, Washington, Indiana, and North Carolina.
The document contains strict warnings about the confidential nature of criminal history records and penalties for unauthorized dissemination.
